Actually the key to winning a battle is not agility or armor, strength
or d=
exterity, it is playing as much as you can to your strengths while
trying t=
o force your enemy to play by his weaknesses and hope that you
are better a=
t your strongest than your enemy is at his weakest!

While MAGMATRON has be=
en showing a surprising amount of dexterity and
agility, his main strength =
would appear to be his armor and brute
force, which he has thus far been pl=
aying to his best affect. Also the
fact that TUSCON has already been damage=
d once by trying to deflect
his plasma blast with his arm has helped immens=
ly.

Agility takes power, that is a warrior's maxim. The heavier you are,
t=
he more power it takes to propell yourself through the air. It
applied to T=
USCON as much as it did to MAGMATRON. Although MAGMATRON
was signifigantly =
heavier than TUSCON, TUSCON was not light weight
either. He was built to be=
 a PRIME.

It was two dragons fighting each other, one nearly twice as larg=
e as
the other, both skilled and full of their own anger and power! As much=

as TUSCON was relying on agility and training, it was obvious to
onlookers=
 that MAGMATRON was also well trained.

A veteran of wars and battles that =
TUSCON had only seen in historical
video, MAGMATRON was also well versed in=
 many of the combat arts and a
master of several!

In this draconic mode MA=
GMATRON was like some chimeric dragon-like
creature, his powerful forearms =
slashing out visciously at TUSCON,
ignoring the music and noise coming from=
 the others!

d the others.

l

sit=
uation that the SHARKTICONS of old may not have grasped. However
these new =
ones seemed to be a bit more astute, even with their master
under attack an=
d not able to give them more direct orders.

With the work of DINOBOT and the MAXIMAL FUZORS as wel=

and QUICKSTRIDE the SHARKTICONS were nearly spent!

Except fo=
r the few still attacking QUICKSTRIDE most of them had
clustered around SKY=
BYTE, there were perhaps 20 of them left as oppose
to the horde of them see=
med to almost boil into the room a few minutes
ago . . .

. . . could it re=
ally have been so short of a time span? . . .

SKYBYTE's smile had little h=
umor in it as he watched the scene.
Instead it had hints of fear and, a los=
s of the supreme confidence
that he once had. His optics glanced across the=
 SHARKTICON carcasses
that littered the floor.

=93ATTACK!!!=94 He yelled o=
ut, forgetting about the poetry and the finesse
of it all, and with that si=
ngle word SKYBYTE sent his last remaining
SHARKTICONS into battle! Meanwhil=
e he himself began back peddling
towards MAGMATRON was battling TUSCON.

was once OPTIMUS PRIME, the blackened figure that had
